meanings.definition: An excessive amount or quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: The overabundances of candy at the party made the children very happy.
meanings.sent2: The store had overabundances of fresh fruits and vegetables for sale.
meanings.sent3: The overabundances of toys in the store tempted the kids to spend all their pocket money.
meanings.sent4: Her overabundances of energy were like a never-ending waterfall, always flowing.
meanings.sent5: The overabundances of stars in the night sky took her breath away.

meanings.definition: The state of having more than enough of a particular resource or commodity.
meanings.sent1: The overabundances of water in the reservoir led to flooding in the area.
meanings.sent2: The overabundances of books in the library meant there was always something new to read.
meanings.sent3: His overabundances of jokes at the party kept everyone laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: The overabundances of sunlight in the desert made the sand shimmer like gold.
meanings.sent5: The overabundances of food at the buffet made it hard to choose what to eat first.
